medium_description_en: Calculates age-adjusted ESR and CRP in adult patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

seo.meta_description_en: The Age-Adjustment Calculator for ESR and CRP calculates age-adjusted ESR and CRP in patients with late-onset and younger-onset rheumatoid arthritis.
seo.keywords_en: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate, c-reactive protein values, ESR, CRP, age adjustment, age-adjustment, rheumatoid arthritis

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the Age-Adjusted ESR and CRP and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the Age-Adjusted ESR and CRP and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.formula_en:
Male:

ESR upper limit of normal, mm/hr = age / 2

CRP upper limit of normal, mg/dL = age / 50

Female:

ESR upper limit of normal, mm/hr = (age + 10) / 2

CRP upper limit of normal, mg/dL = (age / 50) + 0.6

Original/Primary Reference.text: Ranganath VK, Elashoff DA, Khanna D, et al. Age adjustment corrects for apparent differences in erythrocyte sedimentation rate and C-reactive protein values at the onset of seropositive rheumatoid arthritis in younger and older patients. J Rheumatol. 2005;32(6):1040-2.

creator_info.about_en: Veena K. Ranganath, MD, MS, is an associate clinical professor in the rheumatology division at the David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA. She is also the co-director of the UCLA Masters in Clinical Research program. Dr. Ranganath’s primary research is focused on general rheumatology and rheumatoid arthritis.
